location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Resident plans to embark on his annual tour of the Arabian Coast on the 15 March 1853; the Resident is going to use the tour in order to negotiate a permanent peace among the Arabian chiefs. It states that he intends for his assistant Herbert Frederick Disbrowe to accompany him, and that he will use the Cliveto undertake the trip.It also notes that the Resident hopes that it will be possible to dispatch the Constanceto the Batinah Coast [Al-Bāṭinah] in order to intercept slave ships.
